Rest

By Zinzy Waleson Geene, published onSunday, 20 November, 2022

Simmering down is a challenge this week. I wake, daily before 6am, and jump straight into the day. My jump doesn‚Äôt land me in a FOMO-inducing Instagram feed or a busy news site, but on a blank screen that waits eagerly as I type my 1,000 words of the morning. It‚Äôs another one of the Habits I picked up this autumn. Me, the darkness outside, and a soft light in the living room acquainting me with the day. It‚Äôs pleasing to meet myself, unfiltered.

It‚Äôs also one of the few moments of solitude and focus I allow myself this week, apparently. Now that I‚Äôm beginning to reintegrate back into work at [[ Public/_notes/Leeruniek ]], I seem to have forgotten how much down time my body still requires. I‚Äôve received a work assignment, on which I‚Äôll get to work independently, and I‚Äôm excited. Curious. Hungry. On the cusp of small-scale overdrive. I had to stop working precisely because of this.

It‚Äôs boring.

Then I remember and old way to find calm and relaxation. The voices of Josh Clark and Chuck Bryant, telling me about stuff I should know.

What‚Äôs top of mind right now

  • Saw Hannah Gadsby‚Äôs Body of Work and had a brief, cogent crush on her
  • Saw a large number of Twitter folks join the much kinder Mastodon club. I‚Äôm slowly beginning to feel comfortable about the platform, and how it invites me to share my thoughts.
  • I‚Äôm thinking a lot about what ex-Twitter designer Jon Bell said about Twitter‚Äôs user experience trajectory. I keep saying out loud how central the difference between doing the right thing and doing the thing right is to the design work I do.

Zinzy Waleson Geene (she/ they) is a researcher, designer, and queer facilitator from Amsterdam. She's interested in humanities and behavioral sciences, yoga practice, and amateur cooking. She engages in mellow cultural and critical analysis, linking and tinkering on her personal website, zinzy.website .
